subject: Mental Health
title: Demonic Possession in the Middle Ages
description: A quick win: understand Demonic Possession in the Middle Ages.

hook.text: In medieval Europe, hearing voices meant you were possessed by demons.

buildup.text: The Church dominated medical thought and saw madness as spiritual corruption.

discovery.text: Exorcisms, fasting, and prayer were the primary treatments for mental illness.

twist.text: Some scholars argue medieval care was sometimes more compassionate than what came later.

climax.text: The witch trials conflated mental illness with sorcery, killing thousands.

punchline.text: When you can't explain suffering, you blame the sufferer.

quiz.question: How was mental illness primarily explained in medieval Europe?
